snippet: Dr. Olney, a leading researcher of A.L.S., commonly known as Lou Gehrig’s disease, learned in 2004 that he himself had it.
abstract: Richard K Olney, a leading physician and pioneer in clinical research on amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease, dies of the disease at age 64.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Olney, a leading researcher of A.L.S., commonly known as Lou Gehrig’s disease, learned in 2004 that he himself had it.

headline.seo: Dr. Richard K. Olney, A.L.S. Researcher, Dies at 64.
headline.main: Dr. Richard K. Olney, Felled by the Disease He Studied, Is Dead at 64
headline.print_headline: Richard K. Olney, 64, Dies; Felled by Disease He Studied
